data.name: ApiKey_Description
data.value: The API key for the server.

data.name: App_FullName
data.value: NuGet Command Line

data.name: ConsoleConfirmMessageAccept
data.value: y

data.name: Delete_Description
data.value: Deletes a package from the server.

data.name: Delete_MissingArguments
data.value: Please provide arguments for package id and package version.

data.name: Delete_PackageIdAndVersion_Description
data.value: The Package Id and version.

data.name: DisableBuffering_Description
data.value: Disable buffering when pushing to an HTTP(S) server to decrease memory usage.

data.name: NoSymbols_Description
data.value: If a symbols package exists, it will not be pushed to a symbols server.

data.name: NonInteractive_Description
data.value: Do not prompt for user input or confirmations.

data.name: Push_Description
data.value: Pushes a package to the server and publishes it.

data.name: Push_MissingArguments
data.value: Please specify the path to the package.

data.name: Push_Package_ApiKey_Description
data.value: Specify the path to the package and your API key to push the package to the server.

data.name: Push_Timeout_Description
data.value: Timeout for pushing to a server in seconds. Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes).

data.name: Source_Description
data.value: Package source (URL, UNC/folder path or package source name) to use. Defaults to DefaultPushSource if specified in NuGet.Config.

data.name: Push_InvalidTimeout
data.value: Invalid timeout parameter value.

data.name: Push_Timeout_Error
data.value: Pushing took too long. You can change the default timeout of 300 seconds by using the --timeout <seconds> option with the push command.

data.name: ForceEnglishOutput_Description
data.value: Forces the application to run using an invariant, English-based culture.

data.name: OutputNuGetVersion
data.value: {0} Version: {1}

data.name: SymbolSource_Description
data.value: Symbol server URL to use.

data.name: SymbolApiKey_Description
data.value: The API key for the symbol server.

data.name: LocalsCommand_ArgumentDescription
data.value: Specifies the cache location(s) to list or clear. <all | http-cache | global-packages | temp>

data.name: LocalsCommand_ClearDescription
data.value: Clear the selected local resources or cache location(s).

data.name: LocalsCommand_ListDescription
data.value: List the selected local resources or cache location(s).

data.name: LocalsCommand_Description
data.value: Clears or lists local NuGet resources such as http requests cache, packages folder, plugin operations cache or machine-wide global packages folder.

data.name: LocalsCommand_MultipleOperations
data.value: Both operations, --list and --clear, are not supported in the same command. Please specify only one operation. usage: NuGet locals <all | http-cache | global-packages | temp | plugins-cache> [--clear | -c | --list | -l] For more information, visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: LocalsCommand_NoArguments
data.value: No Cache Type was specified. usage: NuGet locals <all | http-cache | global-packages | temp | plugins-cache> [--clear | -c | --list | -l] For more information, visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: LocalsCommand_NoOperation
data.value: Please specify an operation i.e. --list or --clear. usage: NuGet locals <all | http-cache | global-packages | temp | plugins-cache> [--clear | -c | --list | -l] For more information, visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: Error_MsBuildUnableToOpenProject

data.name: AddPkg_NoRestoreDescription

data.name: AddSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Add a NuGet source.

data.name: DisableSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Disable a NuGet source.

data.name: EnableSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Enable a NuGet source.

data.name: ListSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Lists all configured NuGet sources.

data.name: RemoveSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Remove a NuGet source.

data.name: UpdateSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Update a NuGet source.

data.name: SourcesCommandNameDescription
data.value: Name of the source.

data.name: SourcesCommandPasswordDescription
data.value: Password to be used when connecting to an authenticated source.

data.name: SourcesCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Path to the package source.

data.name: SourcesCommandFormatDescription
data.value: The format of the list command output: `Detailed` (the default) and `Short`.

data.name: SourcesCommandUsernameDescription
data.value: Username to be used when connecting to an authenticated source.

data.name: SourcesCommandStorePasswordInClearTextDescription
data.value: Enables storing portable package source credentials by disabling password encryption.

data.name: SourcesCommandValidAuthenticationTypesDescription
data.value: Comma-separated list of valid authentication types for this source. Set this to basic if the server advertises NTLM or Negotiate and your credentials must be sent using the Basic mechanism, for instance when using a PAT with on-premises Azure DevOps Server. Other valid values include negotiate, kerberos, ntlm, and digest, but these values are unlikely to be useful.
data.comment: Please don't localize "basic, NTLM, Negotiate, kerberos, ntlm, digest"

data.name: Option_ConfigFile
data.value: The NuGet configuration file. If specified, only the settings from this file will be used. If not specified, the hierarchy of configuration files from the current directory will be used. For more information, see https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/configuring-nuget-behavior.

data.name: Option_PackageSource
data.value: Package source name.

data.name: Option_Path
data.value: Path to certificate file.

data.name: Option_Password
data.value: Password for the certificate, if needed.

data.name: Option_StorePasswordInClearText
data.value: Enables storing password for the certificate by disabling password encryption.

data.name: Option_StoreLocation
data.value: Certificate store location (see docs).

data.name: Option_StoreName
data.value: Certificate store name (see docs).

data.name: Option_FindBy
data.value: Search method to find certificate in certificate store (see docs).

data.name: Option_FindValue
data.value: Search the certificate store for the supplied value. Used with FindValue (see docs).

data.name: Option_Force
data.value: Skip certificate validation.

data.name: Add_Description
data.value: Add a NuGet source.

data.name: Disable_Description
data.value: Disable a NuGet source.

data.name: Enable_Description
data.value: Enable a NuGet source.

data.name: List_Description
data.value: List configured NuGet sources.

data.name: Remove_Description
data.value: Remove a NuGet source.

data.name: Update_Description
data.value: Update a NuGet source.

data.name: Sources_Redirect
data.value: The proper command is '{0}'.

data.name: ListClientCertCommandDescription
data.value: Lists all the client certificates in the configuration.

data.name: RemoveClientCertCommandDescription
data.value: Removes the client certificate configuration that matches the given package source name.

data.name: UpdateClientCertCommandDescription
data.value: Updates the client certificate configuration that matches the given package source name.

data.name: AddClientCertCommandDescription
data.value: Adds a client certificate configuration that matches the given package source name.

data.name: Verbosity_Description
data.value: Set the verbosity level of the command. Allowed values are q[uiet], m[inimal], n[ormal], d[etailed], and diag[nostic].

data.name: AddPkg_PackagePrerelease
data.value: Allows prerelease packages to be installed.

data.name: Error_PrereleaseWhenVersionSpecified
data.value: The --prerelease and --version options are not supported in the same command.

data.name: Error_NoVersionsAvailable
data.value: There are no versions available for the package '{0}'.

data.name: PrereleaseVersionsAvailable
data.value: There are no stable versions available, {0} is the best available. Consider adding the --prerelease option

data.name: VerifyCommandAllDescription
data.value: Specifies that all verifications possible should be performed to the package(s).

data.name: VerifyCommandCertificateFingerprintDescription
data.value: Verify that the signer certificate matches with one of the specified SHA256 fingerprints. A certificate SHA256 fingerprint is a SHA256 hash of the certificate used to identify the certificate. Multiple inputs should be separated by space.

data.name: VerifyCommandDescription
data.value: Verifies a signed NuGet package.

data.name: VerifyCommandPackagePathDescription
data.value: Specify the path to the package

data.name: TrustCommandAlgorithm
data.value: Specifies the hash algorithm used to calculate the certificate fingerprint. Defaults to SHA256. Values supported are SHA256, SHA384 and SHA512.

data.name: TrustCommandAllowUntrustedRoot
data.value: Specifies if the certificate for the trusted signer should be allowed to chain to an untrusted root. This is not recommended.

data.name: TrustCommandDescription
data.value: Manage the trusted signers.

data.name: TrustCommandOwners
data.value: Semi-colon separated list of trusted owners to further restrict the trust of a repository.

data.name: SignCommandOutputDirectoryDescription
data.value: Directory where the signed package(s) should be saved. By default the original package is overwritten by the signed package.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateFingerprintDescription
data.value: SHA-1 fingerprint of the certificate used to search a local certificate store for the certificate. The certificate store can be specified by --certificate-store-name and --certificate-store-location options.

data.name: SignCommandCertificatePasswordDescription
data.value: Password for the certificate, if needed. This option can be used to specify the password for the certificate. The command will throw an error message if certificate is password protected but password is not provided as input.

data.name: SignCommandCertificatePathDescription
data.value: File path to the certificate to be used while signing the package.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateStoreLocationDescription
data.value: Name of the X.509 certificate store use to search for the certificate. Defaults to "CurrentUser", the X.509 certificate store used by the current user. This option should be used when specifying the certificate via --certificate-subject-name or --certificate-fingerprint options.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateStoreNameDescription
data.value: Name of the X.509 certificate store to use to search for the certificate. Defaults to "My", the X.509 certificate store for personal certificates. This option should be used when specifying the certificate via --certificate-subject-name or --certificate-fingerprint options.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateSubjectNameDescription
data.value: Subject name of the certificate used to search a local certificate store for the certificate. The search is a case-insensitive string comparison using the supplied value, which will find all certificates with the subject name containing that string, regardless of other subject values. The certificate store can be specified by --certificate-store-name and --certificate-store-location options.

data.name: SignCommandHashAlgorithmDescription
data.value: Hash algorithm to be used to sign the package. Defaults to SHA256.

data.name: SignCommandOverwriteDescription
data.value: Switch to indicate if the current signature should be overwritten. By default the command will fail if the package already has a signature.

data.name: SignCommandPackagePathDescription
data.value: Signs NuGet packages at <package-paths> with the specified certificate.

data.name: SignCommandTimestamperDescription
data.value: URL to an RFC 3161 timestamping server.

data.name: SignCommandTimestampHashAlgorithmDescription
data.value: Hash algorithm to be used by the RFC 3161 timestamp server. Defaults to SHA256.

data.name: SignCommandDescription
data.value: Signs NuGet package(s) at <package-paths> with the specified certificate.

data.name: SignCommandNoTimestamperWarning
data.value: The '--timestamper' option was not provided. The signed package will not be timestamped. To learn more about this option, please visit https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools

data.name: Err_InvalidValue
data.value: Invalid value provided for '{0}'. The accepted values are {1}.
data.comment: {0} - argument name in SignCommand. e.g. certificate storeName, certificate storelocation, hashAlgorithmName {1} - the possible values of the argument.

data.name: SignCommandMultipleCertificateException
data.value: Multiple options were used to specify a certificate.

data.name: SignCommandNoCertificateException
data.value: No certificate was provided.

data.name: TrustAuthorCommandDescription
data.value: Adds a trusted signer with the given name, based on the author signature of the package.

data.name: TrustListCommandDescription
data.value: Lists all the trusted signers in the configuration.

data.name: TrustRemoveCommandDescription
data.value: Removes any trusted signers that match the given name.

data.name: TrustRepositoryCommandDescription
data.value: Adds a trusted signer with the given name, based on the repository signature or countersignature of a signed package.

data.name: TrustSyncCommandDescription
data.value: Deletes the current list of certificates and replaces them with an up-to-date list from the repository.

data.name: TrustCertificateFingerprint
data.value: The fingerprint of the certificate.

data.name: TrustedCertificateSignerNameToAdd
data.value: The name of the trusted signer to add. If a trusted signer with the given name already exists, the certificate item is added to that signer. Otherwise a trusted author is created with a certificate item from the given certificate information.

data.name: TrustedSignerNameExists
data.value: The name of the existing trusted signer to sync.

data.name: TrustedSignerNameToAdd
data.value: The name of the trusted signer to add. If name already exists in the configuration, the signature is appended.

data.name: TrustedSignerNameToRemove
data.value: The name of the existing trusted signer to remove.

data.name: TrustLocalSignedNupkgPath
data.value: The given package should be a local path to the signed .nupkg file.

data.name: TrustSourceCommandDescription
data.value: Adds a trusted signer based on a given package source.

data.name: TrustSourceSignerName
data.value: "The name of the trusted signer to add. If only <NAME> is provided without --<source-url>, the package source from your NuGet configuration files with the same name is added to the trusted list. If <NAME> already exists in the configuration, the package source is appended to it."

data.name: TrustSourceUrl
data.value: If a source-url is provided, it must be a v3 package source URL (like https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json). Other package source types are not supported.

data.name: Error_TrustedRepoAlreadyExists
data.value: A trusted repository with the service index '{0}' already exists.

data.name: Error_TrustedSignerAlreadyExists
data.value: A trusted signer '{0}' already exists.

data.name: Error_TrustFingerPrintAlreadyExist
data.value: The certificate finger you're trying to add is already in the certificate fingerprint list.

data.name: Warning_HttpServerUsage
data.value: You are running the '{0}' operation with an 'HTTP' source, '{1}'. Non-HTTPS access will be removed in a future version. Consider migrating to an 'HTTPS' source.
data.comment: 0 - The command name. Ex. Push/Delete. 1 - server uri.

data.name: Warning_HttpServerUsage_MultipleSources
data.value: You are running the '{0}' operation with 'HTTP' sources: {1} Non-HTTPS access will be removed in a future version. Consider migrating to 'HTTPS' sources.
data.comment: 0 - The command name. Ex. Push/Delete. 1 - list of server uris

data.name: Debug_CurrentUICulture
data.value: DefaultThreadCurrentUICulture value: {0}

data.name: Error_InvalidCultureInfo
data.value: Invalid culture identifier in {0} environment variable. Value read is '{1}'
data.comment: 0 - Environment variable name, 1 - value set in environment variable

data.name: Info_AddPkgCPM
data.value: PackageReference for package '{0}' added to '{1}' and PackageVersion added to central package management file '{2}'.
data.comment: 0 - The package ID. 1 - Directory.Packages.props file path. 2 - Project file path.

data.name: ListPkg_OutputFormatDescription
data.value: Set the report output format.

data.name: ListPkg_OutputVersionDescription
data.value: The version of report output.

data.name: ListPkg_InvalidOutputFormat
data.value: Invalid value {0} provided for output format. The accepted values are {1}.
data.comment: {0} - argument name in format option {1} - the possible values of the argument.

data.name: ListPkg_InvalidOutputVersion
data.value: Unsupported output format version {0} was requested. The accepted format version value is {1}.
data.comment: {0} - argument name in version option {1} - the possible value of the argument.

data.name: ListPkg_OutputVersionNotApplicable
data.value: '--output-version' option not applicable for console output, it can only be used together with `--format json` option.

data.name: Error_CentralPackageVersions_VersionsNotAllowed
data.value: Projects that use central package version management should not define the version on the PackageReference items but on the PackageVersion items: {0}

data.name: Error_AddPkg_CentralPackageVersions_EmptyVersionOverride
data.value: VersionOverride for package '{0}' should not be empty.

data.name: Error_AddPkg_CentralPackageVersions_PackageReference_WrongLocation
data.value: Package reference for package '{0}' defined in incorrect location, PackageReference should be defined in project file.

data.name: Error_AddPkg_CentralPackageVersions_PackageVersion_WrongLocation
data.value: PackageVersion for package '{0}' defined in incorrect location, PackageVersion should be defined in Directory.Package.props.

data.name: Error_CentralPackageVersions_AutoreferencedReferencesNotAllowed
data.value: The packages {0} are implicitly referenced. You do not typically need to reference them from your project or in your central package versions management file. For more information, see https://aka.ms/sdkimplicitrefs

data.name: Error_CentralPackageVersions_FloatingVersionsAreNotAllowed
data.value: Centrally defined floating package versions are not allowed.

data.name: Error_CentralPackageVersions_MissingPackageVersion
data.value: The PackageReference items {0} do not have corresponding PackageVersion.

data.name: Error_CentralPackageVersions_VersionOverrideDisabled
data.value: The package reference {0} specifies a VersionOverride but the ability to override a centrally defined version is currently disabled.

data.name: ConfigPathsCommandDescription
data.value: Lists the paths to all NuGet configuration files that will be applied when invoking NuGet command in a specific directory

data.name: ConfigPathsWorkingDirectoryDescription
data.value: Specifies the directory to start from when listing configuration files. If not specified, the current directory is used.

data.name: Config_Description
data.value: NuGet configuration CLI

data.name: Error_PathNotFound
data.value: The specified path '{0}' does not exist.

data.name: ConfigCommandKeyNotFound
data.value: Key '{0}' not found.

data.name: ConfigGetAllOrConfigKeyDescription
data.value: All: Get all merged NuGet configuration settings from multiple NuGet configuration files that will be applied, when invoking NuGet command from the working directory path. ConfigKey: Get the effective value of the specified configuration settings of the config section.

data.name: ConfigGetShowPathDescription
data.value: Indicate that the NuGet configuration file path will be shown besides the configuration settings.

data.name: ConfigGetCommandDescription
data.value: Gets the NuGet configuration settings that will be applied.
